Edon, Richard, fellow or scholar of St. John’s Coll. in and before 1565, a student of Lincoln's Inn 1564, as of Suffolk, gent., and probably 3s. of Thomas, of Sudbury, clerk of the Star Chamber. See Foster’s Inns of Court Reg. [lO] Edon, Thomas, of co. Warwick, pleb. Gloucester Hall, matric. entry under date 10 Jan., 1574-5, aged 16. All Souls’ Coll., matric. 9 April, 1644, aged 16, B.A. 27 June ; 1649, probably scholar of Jesus Coll. 12 Oct., 1648, by visitors, sinecure rector of Llanrhaiadr (in Mochnant), 1653. Exeter Coll., matric. 4 April, 1600. aged 17, B.A. 5 Feb., 1603-4 ; M.A. from Broadgates Hall 31 Oct., 1606, B.D. 14 April, 1614, rector of Honiton 1614, and Clyst St. Laurence, Devon, 1612 ; father of John 1630. See Walker’s Sufferings , ii. 23 7 ; & Foster's Index Eccl. Eedes, John, B.A. from St. John’s Coll., Cambridge, * 1610 ; incorp. as M.A. 13 July, 1619, perhaps rector of Lawford, Essex, 16x6-59 ; licenced 13 Dec. , 1616, to marry Thomazine, daughter of late Baldwin Dereham, deceased. See. London Marriage Licences, ed. Foster. Eedes, John, s. Nicholas, of Salisbury, Wilts, pleb.
